item.title: 中国允许基金和经纪人使用中国人民银行资金购买股票
item.description: 中国将允许基金和经纪商利用央行的资金购买股票，这是旨在提振经济和提升投资者情绪的一揽子广泛措施的一部分。【原文：China will allow funds and brokers to tap the central bank’s funding to buy stocks, as part of a broad package of measures designed to boost the economy and lift investor sentiment.】

item.title: 中国政府采取一系列措施援助经济，铁矿石飙升
item.description: 在中国宣布一系列促进经济增长的措施后，铁矿石飙升，提振了世界最大进口国的需求前景。【原文：Iron ore spiked after China announced a series of measures to boost growth, buoying the outlook for demand in the world’s largest importer.】

item.title: 随着交易的临近，Vista、Blackstone 使 Smartsheet 债务条款更加优惠
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Vista Equity Partners 和 Blackstone Inc. 已向支持其收购 Smartsheet Inc.【原文：Vista Equity Partners and Blackstone Inc. have made several concessions to a group of private lenders backing their proposed acquisition of Smartsheet Inc. as they inch closer to a deal with the software maker, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 中国 10 年期债券收益率有史以来首次降至 2
item.description: 随着中国央行宣布一揽子货币政策宽松措施以支持经济增长，中国基准债券收益率有史以来首次跌至 2%。【原文：China’s benchmark bond yield fell to 2% for the first time on record, as the central bank announced a package of monetary policy easing measures to support growth.】

item.title: 日元面临不利因素，削弱美联储大幅减息的优势
item.description: 日元正面临着诸多不利因素，这些因素似乎超过了美联储降息带来的任何好处。【原文：The yen is facing a multitude of negatives that seem to be outweighing any advantage it’s gained from the bumper Federal Reserve interest-rate cut.】

item.title: X 上的 OpenAI 新闻账户遭入侵，发送有关加密货币的帖子
item.description: OpenAI称，其在X上的一个账户于周一遭到入侵，当时一个未经授权的人发出帖子，招揽用户点击进入一个加密代币，谎称与人工智能初创公司有关。【原文：OpenAI said one of its accounts on X was compromised on Monday, when an unauthorized individual sent out posts soliciting users to click through to a crypto token falsely claiming to be related to the artificial intelligence startup.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）希望在可再生能源组合中开展酒精变喷气机项目
item.description: 巴西国家石油公司计划投资一项工艺，利用玉米或甘蔗乙醇将酒精转化为可持续航空燃料。【原文：Petrobras plans to invest in a process to convert alcohol into sustainable aviation fuel using corn or sugarcane ethanol.】

item.title: 以色列袭击黎巴嫩引发紧张情绪，石油走高
item.description: 以色列对黎巴嫩发动空袭，造成近 500 人死亡，引发了人们对中东爆发全面战争的担忧，此后石油价格走高。【原文：Oil edged higher after Israel launched airstrikes on Lebanon that killed nearly 500 people and raised fears of a full-blown war in the Middle East.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好美股继续攀升。波音公司提高了工资报价。交易员们正密切关注澳大利亚央行的动向。以下是市场动向。【原文：Good morning. US stocks just keep on climbing. Boeing increases its wage offer. And traders are keeping a close eye on the RBA. Here’s what’s moving markets. —Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 众议院批准芯片许可证豁免，并将法案送交拜登
item.description: 美国众议院批准了一项立法，规定某些半导体制造项目免于联邦许可要求，以消除人们对环境审查和诉讼会延误国内芯片工厂建设的担忧。【原文：The US House approved legislation that would exempt some semiconductor manufacturing projects from federal permitting requirements, addressing concerns that environmental reviews and lawsuits will delay construction of domestic chip factories.】

item.title: 伦敦高管呼吁改革治理和养老金制度以吸引更多 IPO
item.description: 一项调查发现，英国政府应优先简化公司治理要求，鼓励养老基金投资本地股票，以增强英国资本市场的吸引力。【原文：The British government should prioritize streamlining corporate governance requirements and encouraging pension funds to invest in local stocks to boost the appeal of the UK’s capital markets, a survey finds.】

item.title: 中国选股者转向 ETF 损失 3120 亿美元资产
item.description: 中国股市的无情暴跌已迫使明星基金经理失业，投资者损失惨重，主动型基金资产也从高峰期缩水 40%。然而，市场的一角却在蓬勃发展。【原文：A relentless slump in Chinese equities has pushed star money managers out of jobs, left investors saddled with losses and driven a 40% drawdown in active fund assets from their peak. Yet one corner of the market has been booming.】

item.title: 美国再次降息，亚洲股市有望上涨：市场综述
item.description: 在几位美联储政策制定者暗示将进一步放宽政策，以及对中国准备宣布刺激措施的乐观情绪激增之后，亚洲股市将追随华尔街同行走高。【原文：Asian equities are set to follow Wall Street peers higher after several Federal Reserve policymakers hinted at further easing and as optimism surged that China was poised to announce stimulus measures.】

item.title: 备忘录称前推特员工赢得马斯克裁员薪酬之战
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社获得的一份备忘录，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）在与一名前推特（Twitter）员工的未付遣散费法律诉讼中败诉，这名员工在 2022 年埃隆-马斯克接管该社交媒体平台时被解雇。【原文：Elon Musk lost a legal fight over unpaid severance to a former Twitter employee who was laid off when he took over the social media platform in 2022, according to a memo obtained by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 保险沙皇对气候问题发出了 "严厉 "的信息：您可能不得不搬家
item.description: 加拿大主要金融监管机构负责人警告说，气候风险保险成本的飙升和难度的增加可能会迫使人们搬迁。【原文：The soaring cost and difficulty of insuring against climate risks may force people to relocate, the head of Canada’s main financial regulator warned.】

item.title: 交易员抢购中国 ETF 看涨期权，刺激经济希望渺茫
item.description: 投资者抢购追踪中国股市的交易所交易基金看涨期权，因为市场猜测中国政府将加大刺激力度以促进经济增长，导致股价上涨。【原文：Investors snapped up bullish options on exchange-traded funds tracking Chinese equities as shares gained on speculation that the government will increase stimulus to bolster economic growth.】

item.title: 约翰-马龙的自由宽带公司寻求与 Charter Cable 合并
item.description: 有线电视亿万富翁约翰-马龙（John Malone）的自由宽带公司（Liberty Broadband Corp.【原文：Cable billionaire John Malone’s Liberty Broadband Corp. is proposing an all-stock merger with Charter Communications Inc., one of the top pay-TV providers in the US and another of the media investor’s key holdings.】

item.title: 纽约市主计长布拉德-兰德（Brad Lander）放弃上调所得税的提议
item.description: 纽约市主计长布拉德-兰德（Brad Lander）是一位进步的民主党人，他将在明年的初选中挑战市长埃里克-亚当斯（Eric Adams）。【原文：New York City Comptroller Brad Lander, a progressive Democrat who is challenging Mayor Eric Adams in next year’s primary, backed away from a proposal to increase the city’s income tax on the top 1% of earners.】

item.title: 阿尔伯塔基金聘请前高盛银行家斯库德勒里管理私人资产
item.description: 加拿大最大的养老金管理公司之一阿尔伯塔投资管理公司（Alberta Investment Management Corp.【原文：Alberta Investment Management Corp., one of Canada’s largest pension managers, is elevating two senior executives and giving them new responsibilities as Chief Investment Officer Marlene Puffer departs.】

item.title: 丰收之后，日本仍将与大米通胀作斗争
item.description: 随着农民收获新的作物，预计日本超市货架上很快就会重新摆满一袋袋大米，不过供应量的增加对抑制价格上涨作用不大。【原文：Bags of rice are expected to start filling the shelves of Japan’s supermarkets again soon as farmers harvest their new crop, though the increase in supply will do little to tame higher prices.】

item.title: 日本央行因美联储加息而受刺激 计划重拾政府债券
item.description: 在日本人口最少的地区运营的一家银行正在做一件事，如果它的同行也这样做的话，可能会在全球产生影响：这家银行正计划随着利率的上升，大举重返日本的债券市场。【原文：A bank operating in Japan’s least populated area is doing something that may have global repercussions if its peers do the same: the lender is planning to return to the nation’s bonds in a big way as interest rates rise.】

item.title: 黑色神话：悟空》为中国偏远省份带来疯狂游客
item.description: 一款电子游戏激发了 24 岁的医科学生王欣雨（音译）的灵感，让她前往位于中国北部偏远省份山西省的家乡参观两座古寺。【原文：It took a video game to inspire 24-year-old medical student Wang Xinyu to visit two ancient temples in her hometown in the remote northern Chinese province of Shanxi.】

item.title: 云计算公司雪花寻求发行 20 亿美元可转换债券
item.description: Snowflake Inc. 正寻求通过出售可转换债券筹集 20 亿美元。【原文：Snowflake Inc. is seeking to raise $2 billion from the sale of convertible bonds.】

item.title: Equinor 已为价值 90 亿美元的巴西天然气项目找到供应商
item.description: Equinor ASA 首席执行官安德斯-奥佩达尔（Anders Opedal）周一表示，Equinor ASA 已经签署了 "所有主要合同"，将在巴西沿海建设一个大型天然气开发项目，预计于 2028 年投产。【原文：Equinor ASA has signed “all major contracts” to build a major natural gas development off the coast of Brazil that is expected to start production in 2028, Chief Executive Officer Anders Opedal said Monday.】

item.title: 米莱在人气开始下滑之际提出了更清晰的货币之路
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱周一更详细地概述了政府摆脱货币管制的途径，这一政策决定可能会对他摇摆不定的支持率产生重大影响。【原文：Argentine President Javier Milei outlined the government’s path out of currency controls in greater detail Monday, a policy decision that could have a big impact on his wavering approval ratings.】

item.title: 尽管降息，货币市场仍对长期国库券望而却步
item.description: 尽管美联储上周将利率下调了半个百分点，但货币市场基金对购买长期国库券仍犹豫不决。【原文：Money market funds are hesitant to buy longer-term Treasury bills even though the Federal Reserve cut interest rates by a half percentage point last week.】

item.title: Cloudflare 首席执行官力图避开马斯克在巴西与 X 的争执
item.description: 网络提供商 Cloudflare Inc 首席执行官周一表示，该公司既没有帮助埃隆-马斯克的 X 逃避巴西的禁令，也没有在巴西监管机构寻求恢复封锁时给予协助。【原文：Network provider Cloudflare Inc neither helped Elon Musk’s X evade a ban in Brazil nor assisted the country’s regulators as they sought to restore the block, its chief executive officer said Monday.】

item.title: 加密货币矿工停战为暴乱接管比特币矿场留下了可能性
item.description: 尽管比特币矿机制造商比特大陆有限公司（Bitfarms Ltd.）与Riot Platforms Inc.在长达数月的收购战中达成了停战协议，但该协议仍为收购留下了可能性。【原文：While Bitcoin miner Bitfarms Ltd. has brokered a truce with Riot Platforms Inc. over a months-long takeover fight, the agreement still leaves open the possibility for an acquisition.】
